 28/// Unary_func_return_type encapsulates the inference
 29/// of a (block) function's return type from its arguments.
 30template <template <typename, typename> class View,
 31 	  typename Type,
 32	  typename Block,
 33          template <typename> class Functor>
 34struct Unary_func_return_type
 35{
 36  typedef typename Functor<Type>::result_type value_type;
 37
 38  typedef const expr::Unary<Functor, Block, true> block_type;
 39
 40  typedef typename ViewConversion<View, 
 41				  value_type, 
 42				  block_type>::lazy_view_type view_type;
 43};
 44
 45template <template <typename, typename> class View1,
 46 	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
 47          template <typename, typename> class View2,
 48 	  typename Type2, typename Block2,
 49          template <typename, typename> class Functor>
 50struct Binary_func_return_type
 51{
 52  typedef typename Functor<Type1, Type2>::result_type value_type;
 53
 54  typedef const expr::Binary<Functor, Block1, Block2, true> block_type;
 55
 56  // The following projects the two view types onto their respective
 57  // const equivalent and promotes these to a return type.
 58  // Thus, Binary_operator_return_type(const_Matrix, Matrix) -> const_Matrix
 59  // but Binary_operator_return_type(Vector, Matrix) -> failure.
 60  typedef typename 
 61  View_promotion<typename ViewConversion<View1,
 62					value_type,
 63					block_type>::lazy_view_type,
 64		typename ViewConversion<View1,
 65					value_type,
 66					block_type>::lazy_view_type>::type 
 67					view_type;
 68};
 69
 70template <template <typename, typename> class View1,
 71 	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
 72          template <typename, typename> class View2,
 73 	  typename Type2, typename Block2,
 74          template <typename, typename> class View3,
 75 	  typename Type3, typename Block3,
 76          template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor>
 77struct Ternary_func_return_type
 78{
 79  typedef typename Functor<Type1, Type2, Type3>::result_type value_type;
 80
 81  typedef const expr::Ternary<Functor,
 82			      Block1,
 83			      Block2,
 84			      Block3,
 85			      true> block_type;
 86
 87  // The following projects the two view types onto their respective
 88  // const equivalent and promotes these to a return type.
 89  // Thus, Binary_operator_return_type(const_Matrix, Matrix) -> const_Matrix
 90  // but Binary_operator_return_type(Vector, Matrix) -> failure.
 91  typedef typename 
 92  View_promotion<typename View_promotion<
 93    typename ViewConversion<View1,
 94			    value_type,
 95			    block_type>::lazy_view_type,
 96    typename ViewConversion<View2,
 97			    value_type,
 98			    block_type>::lazy_view_type>::type,
 99		typename ViewConversion<View3,
100					value_type,
101					block_type>::lazy_view_type>::type 
102					view_type;
103};
104
105template <template <typename> class Functor,
106	  typename View>
107struct Unary_func_expr;
108
109template <template <typename> class Functor,
110	  template <typename, typename> class View,
111	  typename Type, typename Block>
112struct Unary_func_expr<Functor, View<Type, Block> >
113{
114  typedef Unary_func_return_type<View, Type, Block, Functor> type_trait;
115
116  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
117  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
118
119  static view_type create(View<Type, Block> const& view)
120  {
121    return view_type(block_type(view.block()));
122  }
123};
124
125template <template <typename, typename> class Functor,
126	  typename View1, typename View2>
127struct Binary_func_expr;
128
129template <template <typename, typename> class Functor,
130	  template <typename, typename> class View1,
131	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
132	  template <typename, typename> class View2,
133	  typename Type2, typename Block2>
134struct Binary_func_expr<Functor, View1<Type1, Block1>, View2<Type2, Block2> >
135{
136  typedef Binary_func_return_type<View1, Type1, Block1,
137				  View2, Type2, Block2,
138				  Functor> type_trait;
139
140  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
141  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
142
143  static view_type create(View1<Type1, Block1> const& view1,
144			  View2<Type2, Block2> const& view2)
145  {
146    return view_type(block_type(view1.block(), view2.block()));
147  }
148};
149
150template <template <typename, typename> class Functor,
151	  template <typename, typename> class View,
152	  typename Type, typename Block,
153	  typename S>
154struct Binary_func_expr<Functor,
155			View<Type, Block>,
156			S>
157{
158  static dimension_type const dim = View<Type, Block>::dim;
159  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S> scalar_block_type;
160  typedef Binary_func_return_type<View, Type, Block,
161				  View, S, scalar_block_type,
162				  Functor> type_trait;
163
164  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
165  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
166
167  static view_type create(View<Type, Block> const& view, S scalar)
168  {
169    scalar_block_type sblock(scalar);
170    return view_type(block_type(view.block(), sblock));
171  }
172};
173
174template <template <typename, typename> class Functor,
175	  typename S,
176	  template <typename, typename> class View,
177	  typename Type, typename Block>
178struct Binary_func_expr<Functor,
179			S,
180			View<Type, Block> >
181{
182  static dimension_type const dim = View<Type, Block>::dim;
183  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S> scalar_block_type;
184  typedef Binary_func_return_type<View, S, scalar_block_type,
185                                  View, Type, Block,
186                                  Functor> type_trait;
187
188  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
189  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
190
191  static view_type create(S scalar, View<Type, Block> const& view)
192  {
193    scalar_block_type sblock(scalar);
194    return view_type(block_type(sblock, view.block()));
195  }
196};
197
198template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor,
199	  typename View1, typename View2, typename View3>
200struct Ternary_func_expr;
201
202template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor,
203	  template <typename, typename> class View1,
204	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
205	  template <typename, typename> class View2,
206	  typename Type2, typename Block2,
207	  template <typename, typename> class View3,
208	  typename Type3, typename Block3>
209struct Ternary_func_expr<Functor,
210			 View1<Type1, Block1>,
211			 View2<Type2, Block2>,
212			 View3<Type3, Block3> >
213{
214  typedef Ternary_func_return_type<View1, Type1, Block1,
215				   View2, Type2, Block2,
216				   View3, Type3, Block3,
217				   Functor> type_trait;
218
219  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
220  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
221
222  static view_type create(View1<Type1, Block1> const& view1,
223			  View2<Type2, Block2> const& view2,
224			  View3<Type3, Block3> const& view3)
225  {
226    return view_type(block_type(view1.block(),
227				view2.block(),
228				view3.block()));
229  }
230};
231
232template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor,
233	  template <typename, typename> class View1,
234	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
235	  template <typename, typename> class View2,
236	  typename Type2, typename Block2,
237	  typename S>
238struct Ternary_func_expr<Functor,
239			 View1<Type1, Block1>,
240			 View2<Type2, Block2>,
241			 S>
242{
243  static dimension_type const dim = View1<Type1, Block1>::dim;
244  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S> scalar_block_type;
245  typedef Ternary_func_return_type<View1, Type1, Block1,
246				   View2, Type2, Block2,
247				   View1, S, scalar_block_type,
248				   Functor> type_trait;
249
250  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
251  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
252
253  static view_type create(View1<Type1, Block1> const& view1,
254			  View2<Type2, Block2> const& view2,
255			  S scalar)
256  {
257    scalar_block_type sblock(scalar);
258    return view_type(block_type(view1.block(),
259				view2.block(),
260				sblock));
261  }
262};

264template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor,
265	  template <typename, typename> class View1,
266	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
267	  typename S,
268	  template <typename, typename> class View2,
269	  typename Type2, typename Block2>
270struct Ternary_func_expr<Functor,
271			 View1<Type1, Block1>,
272			 S,
273			 View2<Type2, Block2> >
274{
275  static dimension_type const dim = View1<Type1, Block1>::dim;
276  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S> scalar_block_type;
277  typedef Ternary_func_return_type<View1, Type1, Block1,
278				   View1, S, scalar_block_type,
279				   View2, Type2, Block2,
280				   Functor> type_trait;
281
282  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
283  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
284
285  static view_type create(View1<Type1, Block1> const& view1,
286			  S scalar,
287			  View2<Type2, Block2> const& view2)
288  {
289    scalar_block_type sblock(scalar);
290    return view_type(block_type(view1.block(),
291				sblock,
292				view2.block()));
293  }
294};

296template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor,
297	  typename S,
298	  template <typename, typename> class View1,
299	  typename Type1, typename Block1,
300	  template <typename, typename> class View2,
301	  typename Type2, typename Block2>
302struct Ternary_func_expr<Functor,
303			 S,
304			 View1<Type1, Block1>,
305			 View2<Type2, Block2> >
306{
307  static dimension_type const dim = View1<Type1, Block1>::dim;
308  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S> scalar_block_type;
309  typedef Ternary_func_return_type<View1, S, scalar_block_type,
310				   View1, Type1, Block1,
311				   View2, Type2, Block2,
312				   Functor> type_trait;
313
314  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
315  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
316
317  static view_type create(S scalar,
318			  View1<Type1, Block1> const& view1,
319			  View2<Type2, Block2> const& view2)
320  {
321    scalar_block_type sblock(scalar);
322    return view_type(block_type(sblock,
323				view1.block(),
324				view2.block()));
325  }
326};

328template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor,
329	  template <typename, typename> class View,
330	  typename Type, typename Block,
331	  typename S1,
332	  typename S2>
333struct Ternary_func_expr<Functor,
334			 View<Type, Block>,
335			 S1,
336			 S2>
337{
338  static dimension_type const dim = View<Type, Block>::dim;
339  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S1> scalar_block1_type;
340  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S2> scalar_block2_type;
341  typedef Ternary_func_return_type<View, Type, Block,
342				   View, S1, scalar_block1_type,
343				   View, S2, scalar_block2_type,
344				   Functor> type_trait;
345
346  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
347  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
348
349  static view_type create(View<Type, Block> const& view,
350			  S1 scalar1,
351			  S2 scalar2)
352  {
353    scalar_block1_type sblock1(scalar1);
354    scalar_block2_type sblock2(scalar2);
355    return view_type(block_type(view.block(),
356				sblock1,
357				sblock2));
358  }
359};
360
361template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor,
362	  typename S1,
363	  template <typename, typename> class View,
364	  typename Type, typename Block,
365	  typename S2>
366struct Ternary_func_expr<Functor,
367			 S1,
368			 View<Type, Block>,
369			 S2>
370{
371  static dimension_type const dim = View<Type, Block>::dim;
372  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S1> scalar_block1_type;
373  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S2> scalar_block2_type;
374  typedef Ternary_func_return_type<View, S1, scalar_block1_type,
375				   View, Type, Block,
376				   View, S2, scalar_block2_type,
377				   Functor> type_trait;
378
379  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
380  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
381
382  static view_type create(S1 scalar1,
383			  View<Type, Block> const& view,
384			  S2 scalar2)
385  {
386    scalar_block1_type sblock1(scalar1);
387    scalar_block2_type sblock2(scalar2);
388    return view_type(block_type(sblock1,
389				view.block(),
390				sblock2));
391  }
392};
393
394template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Functor,
395	  typename S1,
396	  typename S2,
397	  template <typename, typename> class View,
398	  typename Type, typename Block>
399struct Ternary_func_expr<Functor,
400			 S1,
401			 S2,
402			 View<Type, Block> >
403{
404  static dimension_type const dim = View<Type, Block>::dim;
405  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S1> scalar_block1_type;
406  typedef expr::Scalar<dim, S2> scalar_block2_type;
407  typedef Ternary_func_return_type<View, S1, scalar_block1_type,
408				   View, S2, scalar_block2_type,
409				   View, Type, Block,
410				   Functor> type_trait;
411
412  typedef typename type_trait::block_type block_type;
413  typedef typename type_trait::view_type view_type;
414
415  static view_type create(S1 scalar1,
416			  S2 scalar2,
417			  View<Type, Block> const& view)
418  {
419    scalar_block1_type sblock1(scalar1);
420    scalar_block2_type sblock2(scalar2);
421    return view_type(block_type(sblock1,
422				sblock2,
423				view.block()));
424  }
425};
426
427template <template <typename> class Func_scalar,
428	  typename T>
429struct Unary_func_view
430{
431  typedef Unary_func_expr<Func_scalar, T> expr;
432  typedef typename expr::view_type result_type;
433  static result_type apply(T const& value)
434  { return expr::create(value);}
435};
436
437template <template <typename, typename> class Func_scalar,
438	  typename T1, typename T2>
439struct Binary_func_view
440{
441  typedef Binary_func_expr<Func_scalar, T1, T2> expr;
442  typedef typename expr::view_type result_type;
443  static result_type apply(T1 const& value1, T2 const& value2)
444  { return expr::create(value1, value2);}
445};
446
447template <template <typename, typename, typename> class Func_scalar,
448	  typename T1, typename T2, typename T3>
449struct Ternary_func_view
450{
451  typedef Ternary_func_expr<Func_scalar, T1, T2, T3> expr;
452  typedef typename expr::view_type result_type;
453  static result_type apply(T1 const& value1, T2 const& value2,
454			   T3 const& value3)
455  { return expr::create(value1, value2, value3);}
456};
